en.av_c1: Suppose that we want to compute the value of factorial(5) using the following recursive factorial implementation.
en.av_c2: The recursive call creates a new copy of the code with n = 5
en.av_c3: The n=5 copy calls a new copy of the code with n = 4
en.av_c4: The n=4 copy calls a new copy of the code with n = 3
en.av_c5: The n=3 copy calls a new copy of the code with n = 2
en.av_c6: The n=2 copy calls a new copy of the code with n = 1
en.av_c7: Now, the base case satisfies and the n=1 recursive copy will return a value of 1.
en.av_c8: The n=2 copy will multiply the return value of the n=1 copy  by 2.
en.av_c9: The n=3 copy will multiply the return value of the n=2 by 3.
en.av_c10: The n=4 copy will multiply the return value of the n=3 by 6.
en.av_c11: The n=5 copy will multiply the return value of the n=4 by 24. This last copy will return the result of the required factorial.
